DataElement.preferredName: Patient Organ Bone Marrow Function Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes and no indicator related to patient adequate organ and marrow function, as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Organ Bone Marrow Function Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to patient adequate organ and marrow function, as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Organ Bone Marrow Function Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A part of the body that performs a specific function.  For example, the heart is an organ.:The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes. :Function; what something is used for.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The normal action performed by a structure or device.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Adequate organ and marrow fun
ReferenceDocuments.description: Adequate organ and marrow function within 14 days prior to the start of treatment. The following laboratory values obtained <= 14 days prior start of treatment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient must have normal organ and marrow function within 7 days prior to the start of treatment.  The following laboratory values obtained <= 7 days prior start of treatment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must have normal organ and marrow function as defined below with baseline labs being drawn within 7 days prior to start of protocol therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient must have normal organ and marrow function (all screening labs should be performed within 10 days of treatment initiation)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient meet organ function requirements for HSCT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must have normal organ and marrow function as defined below with baseline labs being drawn within 14 days prior to start of protocol therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient must have normal organ and marrow function (all screening labs should be performed within 4 weeks of Pre-op Day 1)

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP - Participants must have normal organ and marrow function, defined as lab values (AST, ALT, Alkaline phosphatase, CBC [Platelets, Hemoglobin, WBC], BUN, Total bilirubin, Creatinine, INR/PT/aPTT) within institutional limits of normal or judged to be no
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participants must have normal organ and marrow function, defined as lab values (AST, ALT, Alkaline phosphatase, CBC [Platelets, Hemoglobin, WBC], BUN, Total bilirubin, Creatinine, INR/PT/aPTT) within institutional limits of normal or judged to be not clinically significant by the investigator

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient must have normal organ and marrow function, with screening labs being drawn within 10 days of treatment initiation.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participants must have normal organ and marrow function, defined as lab values (AST, ALT, Alkaline phosphatase, CBC [Platelets, Hemoglobin, WBC], BUN, Total bilirubin and Creatinine) within institutional limits of normal or judged to be not clinically significant by the investigator

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had adequate organ and marrow function lower or equal to ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Adequate bone marrow and organ functions to continue PD-1/L1 ICI as judged by the treating physician

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients without adequate organ and marrow function within 28 days prior to enrollment.

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 12/21/22 added AQT and alt OID, CCTG for ticket number CADSR0001818 cjl.
